Projects What I've been working on lately

MetroVote

a local election tracker

MetroVote began as a project for my journalism and technology class at Northwestern. With minimal setup, it aggregates social media feeds of and news stories about candidates in local elections. I'll be working on an offshoot of MetroVote for the Knight News Innovation Lab at Northwestern. MetroVote is a Ruby on Rails application—you can check it out on my GitHub.

Golden Writer

the posthumous blog of Kathryn N. Bush

My grandmother, Kathryn N. Bush was a writer. Most of her writings took the form of short, inspirational pieces which she photocopied and mailed to her friends. She called herself Golden Writer. After she passed away in the summer of 2011, I realized that she was a blogger before her time. Since then, I've scanned over two hundred of her works and have been publishing them weekly on a blog that I run. You can follow her on twitter at @gldnwriter.

Doorman

upgrade your intercom

Doorman acts as a middleman between you and your apartment's phone-based intercom. Using doorman, you can provide your preferred guests with PIN numbers to enter at the intercom. Doorman will greet them by name and let them in without calling you. When an unknown guest arrives, Doorman will transfer the call to you and your roommates, so you may grant them access at your descretion. My roommates and I have been using Doorman for two years now and I'm working on a version to release to the public.
